meanings.definition: Having the quality of causing a decline in physical or mental health.
meanings.sent1: The degenerative disease made her muscles weaker each day.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the degenerative condition would slowly affect her memory.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, the degenerative illness kept coming back for more.
meanings.sent4: The degenerative effects of stress on the body can be compared to a relentless storm.
meanings.sent5: The image of the degenerative illness eating away at her health stuck in her mind.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a worsening or deterioration over time.
meanings.sent1: The degenerative nature of the old building was evident in its crumbling walls.
meanings.sent2: Over the years, the degenerative condition of the road led to numerous potholes.
meanings.sent3: The degenerative quality of his jokes made them less funny as time went on.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship had a degenerative effect, slowly falling apart like a fragile sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The degenerative state of the garden mirrored the neglect of its owner.
